ahuachapan.name: Ahuachap치n
ahuachapan.description: Known as the 'City of Flowers' and famous for its coffee production, thermal springs, and beautiful mountain landscapes.

cabanas.name: Caba침as
cabanas.description: A small departamento known for its agricultural production, traditional crafts, and peaceful rural landscapes.

chalatenango.name: Chalatenango
chalatenango.description: Known for its cool mountain climate, beautiful landscapes, and traditional Salvadoran culture.

cuscatlan.name: Cuscatl치n
cuscatlan.description: A central departamento known for its historical significance, traditional markets, and agricultural production.

la-libertad.name: La Libertad
la-libertad.description: Famous for its beautiful beaches, surfing spots, and vibrant coastal culture.

la-paz.name: La Paz
la-paz.description: A coastal departamento known for its beaches, agricultural production, and traditional Salvadoran culture.

la-union.name: La Uni칩n
la-union.description: A coastal departamento known for its port, beaches, and the Conchagua volcano with panoramic views.

morazan.name: Moraz치n
morazan.description: Known for its historical significance, mountain landscapes, and traditional Salvadoran culture.

san-miguel.name: San Miguel
san-miguel.description: The second largest city in El Salvador, known for its vibrant culture, festivals, and the San Miguel volcano.

san-salvador.name: San Salvador
san-salvador.description: The capital and largest city of El Salvador, a vibrant urban center with rich history, culture, and modern amenities.

san-vicente.name: San Vicente
san-vicente.description: Known for its historical sites, the San Vicente volcano, and traditional Salvadoran culture.

santa-ana.name: Santa Ana
santa-ana.description: The second most important city, known for its beautiful architecture, coffee production, and cultural heritage.

sonsonate.name: Sonsonate
sonsonate.description: Known for its agricultural production, beautiful beaches, and traditional Salvadoran culture.

usulutan.name: Usulut치n
usulutan.description: A coastal departamento known for its beaches, agricultural production, and traditional Salvadoran culture.
